results.title: A Discussion of Herman Melville's 'Bartleby'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
The student is given an opportunity to develop his own independent critical analysis of the book and then to compare his ideas with those of the critic Charles Van Doren who has considered the work in depth. Explores the many possibilities for creative interpretation.

results.title: A Discussion of Fyodor Dostoyevsky's 'The Crocodile'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
Commentator Clifton Fadiman discusses various themes and ideas presented in the short story “The Crocodile” by Dostoyevsky, and he points out the significance of the themes in relation to the life of the author and certain events in Russian history.

results.title: A Discussion of Frank Stockton's 'The Lady, or the tiger?'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
A study of the classic short story by American writer, Frank R. Stockton. Uses “historical” footage interspersed with dramatic narrative finishing with taunting question of suitor’s choice of doom - the tiger or the lady.

results.title: A Discussion in history
results.brief_description: Illustrates the technique of discussion as a method of teaching at senior high school level, and shows how a well-planned discussion may yield a deeper and clearer understanding of ideas. The subject of the french Revolution is introduced by the lecturer, who then leads the group in an unrehearsed discussion on various aspects of the subject.

results.title: A discovery of freedom
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. This story is a document of 17 year-old Tom’s experiences in the Eureka 150 youth team. “..I realised that my freedoms and rights were things I had taken for granted”.

results.title: A Dignified exit
results.creator_credit: Brian Blake and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines the moral and legal issues involved in the future publication of a manual describing ‘How to commit suicide effectively’ to be published by EXIT- The Society for the Right to Die with Dignity, and also hears the views of three women who have known great suffering through ill-health.

results.title: A Different kind of winning
results.creator_credit: David Streit, Rad Pictures, Learning Corporation of America and Stephen Gyllenhaal
results.brief_description: Although she loves skateboarding, Jody is uneasy when her father insists that she participate in a skateboard competition, expecially as she would be competing against her best friend. Based on the book “Skateboard scramble” by Barbara Douglas.

results.title: A Desperate case
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and Kenneth J. Fairbairn
results.brief_description: A cautionary tale of a typical holiday suitcase. Crammed beyond its capacity, imperfectly fastened, inadequately and confusedly labelled, the railways transport it from station to station, seeking its true abode. Finally, one of its owners comes to the nightmare tribunal where those who maltreat their luggage are dealt with. Did it happen? Was it a dream? Be warned. See this film. Avoid making yours a desperate case.
